content:
Configuring Data Sources for Cards Components

Configure a data source on a card, layout, or flyout to retrieve data from a Salesforce object or an external database. Display the returned data on cards in a layout or flyout.

Cards can have data sources independent of the layout or flyout data source. Administrators can enable or disable data sources for an org, profile, and user level.

Data Source Types

1. Integration Procedures
Uses an Integration Procedure to return data.
2. Apex Remote
Uses an Apex Remote class and method to return data.
3. Apex REST
Uses a REST endpoint of an Apex class to return data from a server or post data to a server.
4. Data Mapper
Uses an Omnistudio Data Mapper Extract interface to return data.
5. Dual
Combines Apex Remote and Apex REST technologies to support hybrid applications available for both web and mobile usage.
6. Parent
Uses data from the parent card or card layout that a flyout is assigned.
7. REST
Uses the standard REST API call to return data.
8. SOQL Query
Uses a Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) to search an org's Salesforce data for specific information.
9. SOSL Query
Construct text-based search queries against the search index with Salesforce Object Search Language (SOSL).
10. Streaming API
Uses the Salesforce Streaming API to push notifications from the server to the client based on criteria that you define.

Configuring a Data Source

* Configuring an Integration Procedure Data Source
* Configuring a SOQL Query Data Source
* Configuring a SOSL Search Data Source
* Configuring an Omnistudio Data Mapper Data Source
* Configuring a REST Web Data Source
* Configuring a REST Data Source Using Named Credentials
* Configuring an Apex REST Data Source
* Configuring an Apex Remote Data Source
* Configuring Dual Data Sources
* Vlocity Streaming API Data Sources

Testing Data Source Settings
title: Configuring Vlocity Data Sources
